revised_title: Chemical Analysis of Thoracic Duct Contents in Humans
tldr: The author analyzes the chemical composition of the thoracic duct in a human subject, finding a high percentage of water, albumen, aqueous and alcoholic extractives, and fatty matters. The fatty matters in chyle differ from those in blood, and the osmazome content in chyle is found to be greater than in blood. The author attributes the white color of chyle to the presence of opaque white salivary matter.
